intro: Aira tenorei var. intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate aira, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and slender, leafy stems. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear pale blue to purple flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to the mild, humid climate of its native region. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of botanical circles.
